name: Tariff of Abominations (1828)
description: A highly protectionist tariff that was vehemently opposed by Southern states as it raised the cost of imported goods they relied on.

name: Compromise Tariff of 1833
description: A legislative response to the Nullification Crisis, it gradually lowered the high rates of the Tariff of Abominations over several years.

name: Morrill Tariff (1861)
description: A sharp increase in tariff rates at the beginning of the Civil War, ostensibly to fund the war effort and protect Northern industries.

name: Underwood Tariff (1913)
description: A major reversal of protectionist policy, it substantially lowered average tariff rates from 40% to 26% and re-imposed a federal income tax.

name: Protectionism
description: The economic policy of restraining trade between states through methods such as tariffs on imported goods, intended to protect domestic industries from foreign competition.

name: Free Trade
description: The economic policy where governments do not restrict imports from or exports to other countries, promoting international commerce.
confidence: history of US free trade agreements

name: U.S. Federal Revenue
description: The income of the U.S. federal government. Before the 16th Amendment and the income tax, it was overwhelmingly dependent on customs duties from tariffs.

name: Sectional Conflict (North vs. South)
description: The deep-seated economic, social, and political divide between the industrial Northern states and the agrarian Southern states in the 19th century.

name: Northern Industrialists
description: The owners of factories and financial institutions in the Northern U.S. who strongly advocated for high tariffs to protect their nascent industries from European competition.

name: Southern Agrarian Interests
description: The landowners, planters, and farmers of the Southern U.S. who advocated for free trade to lower costs on imported goods and to facilitate the export of their agricultural products like cotton and tobacco.

name: Nullification Crisis (1832-33)
description: A major sectional political crisis during Andrew Jackson's presidency, which involved a confrontation between South Carolina and the federal government over the Tariff of Abominations.

name: Fordney-McCumber Tariff (1922)
description: A sharp turn towards protectionism in the post-WWI era, meant to protect US farms and factories from a flood of European imports.

name: Smoot-Hawley Tariff Act (1930)
description: Raised U.S. tariffs on over 20,000 imported goods to record levels. It is widely blamed for worsening the severity of the Great Depression.

name: Great Depression
description: A severe worldwide economic depression that took place mostly during the 1930s, beginning in the United States.

name: Reciprocal Trade Agreements Act (RTAA) (1934)
description: A reversal of Smoot-Hawley, it gave the U.S. President the power to negotiate bilateral, reciprocal trade agreements with other countries.

name: General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT)
description: A legal agreement between many countries, whose overall purpose was to promote international trade by reducing or eliminating trade barriers such as tariffs or quotas. It was created in 1947 in the aftermath of WWII.

name: World Trade Organization (WTO)
description: An intergovernmental organization that regulates and facilitates international trade. It was officially created on January 1, 1995, as the successor to GATT.

name: Uruguay Round (1986-1994)
description: The 8th round of multilateral trade negotiations conducted within the framework of GATT. The round led to the creation of the WTO.

name: Trade Liberalization
description: The removal or reduction of restrictions or barriers on the free exchange of goods between nations. This was the guiding principle of the post-WWII era led by GATT.

name: North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA)
description: A free trade agreement signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States that created a trilateral trade bloc in North America.

name: U.S.-China Trade War
description: A period of escalating trade tensions between the United States and China, beginning in 2018, characterized by the imposition of tit-for-tat tariffs.
source_doc: US China trade war timeline tariffs

name: Section 301 Tariffs (2018)
description: A key tool in the U.S.-China Trade War, these tariffs were imposed by the Trump administration on a wide range of Chinese goods, citing unfair trade practices.
source_doc: US China trade war timeline tariffs
